title: Automatic Music Transcription using Convolutional Neural Networks and Constant-Q transform
author: Yohannis Telila (Università di Pisa), Tommaso Cucinotta (Scuola Superiore Sant'Anna), Davide Bacciu (Università di Pisa), ...
relevance_why: The paper applies convolutional neural networks and constant-Q transforms to automatic music transcription, techniques that could enhance Haohe Liu's research on audio processing, particularly in music source separation and text-to-audio generation.
background: Automatic music transcription involves analyzing audio recordings of musical pieces to detect notes played, which is particularly challenging with polyphonic music.
contribution: This paper introduces a holistic architecture for automatic music transcription using convolutional neural networks and constant-Q transforms, achieving high accuracy in note detection.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily utilized non-negative matrix factorization and various neural network architectures but faced challenges with polyphony and noise.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves note detection by using a convolutional neural network architecture to analyze time-frequency representations of audio signals.

key_innovation: Employs a unique combination of constant-Q transforms for feature extraction and a holistic CNN architecture for simultaneous multi-pitch detection.
real_world_impact: The proposed system can significantly aid musicians by automating the transcription process, making music composition and sharing more accessible.
limitations: The research is based on synthetic data, which may not fully capture the complexities of real-world audio.

new_terms.Constant-Q transform: **Constant-Q transform** is a time-frequency representation that maintains a constant frequency resolution across scales, making it particularly suitable for music analysis.
